title: Explained: How the SCOTUS tariff ruling may be secretly a gift for POTUS
content: The Supreme Court rebuked President Trump's use of emergency powers for imposing sweeping tariffs, deeming it an overreach. Despite this, Trump vowed to continue, raising global tariffs under different legal provisions. This move, while a political setback, strategically allows him to recalibrate his trade policy and potentially renegotiate terms with countries.

title: Moscow closes all international airports amid wave of Ukrainian drone attacks
content: Moscow's four international airports faced temporary closures on Sunday as air defence systems downed 11 Ukrainian drones approaching the capital. Mayor Sergey Sobyanin confirmed the interceptions, while Russia's civil aviation authority cited safety concerns for the flight suspensions. This comes amid ongoing cross-border drone and missile attacks between Russia and Ukraine, now in its fourth year.

title: T20 World Cup: India's winning streak ends in humiliation; lose by 76 runs to SA
content: India suffered a heavy 76-run defeat against South Africa in their Super Eight encounter at Ahmedabad in the T20 World Cup. India's heralded batting line-up faltered under pressure, failing to chase 188. Questionable shots and a lack of partnerships led to the downfall, ending their 12-match unbeaten streak in the T20I World Cups. Earlier, Jasprit Bumrah had impressed with the ball, but it wasn't enough.

title: 'Women, children killed': India strongly condemns Pakistani strikes in Afghanistan
content: India has strongly condemned Pakistan's overnight airstrikes on Afghanistan. The strikes reportedly targeted alleged terror hideouts. India's Ministry of External Affairs highlighted civilian casualties, including women and children, during the holy month of Ramadan. Afghanistan's Ministry of Defence stated that dozens of innocent civilians were martyred and wounded after airstrikes hit a school and residential homes.

title: When Steve Jobs told Apple employees during a townhall: Nike sells shoes, and yet ...
content: Steve Jobs, upon his return to Apple in 1997, found inspiration in Nike's marketing to revitalize the brand. He emphasized that marketing should focus on values and what a company is about, not just product specifications.

title: 'Deeply value friendship with Israel': PM Modi responds to Netanyahu; highlights ties ahead of visit
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to visit Israel soon. He expressed his eagerness for the trip on social media. Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu described the visit as historic. The leaders emphasized the strong bond between India and Israel. They highlighted cooperation in innovation and security. The partnership continues to grow across various sectors.

title: Carlos Alcaraz‚Äôs Qatar Open prize money revealed after golden falcon win
content: Carlos Alcaraz won a massive prize sum for claiming the Qatar Open title, sealing victory in just 52 minutes in Doha. Here‚Äôs everything he took home for his victory. He also revealed what enables him to dominate on every court he has played on around the world as well as his post victory plans.

title: FBI warns of ATM jackpotting incidents across US: What are they, how they work
content: Cybercriminals are increasingly targeting ATMs with 'jackpotting' malware, forcing machines to dispense cash without legitimate transactions. The FBI warns of a surge in these attacks, with significant financial losses reported. Threat actors exploit physical and software vulnerabilities, bypassing security to gain direct control and trigger rapid cash withdrawals, often leaving ATMs unexpectedly out of service.

title: Rashmika Mandanna & Vijay Deverakonda officially announce 'The wedding of VIROSH'
content: Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda have finally made it official ‚Äî and the internet can‚Äôt keep calm. The much-loved duo took to social media to announce their upcoming wedding, sending fans into an emotional frenzy. But that wasn‚Äôt the only surprise. In a heartfelt revelation, the couple shared that their big day will be known as ‚ÄúThe Wedding of VIROSH‚Äù ‚Äî a name that carries years of love, memories and fandom behind it.

title: After humiliating loss, Suryakumar Yadav promises: 'We'll come back stronger'
content: Indian captain Suryakumar Yadav vowed a stronger comeback after India's 76-run T20 World Cup loss to South Africa. Despite a strong start with the ball, India's batting faltered, losing crucial wickets in the powerplay. Yadav emphasized learning from the defeat and aiming for a better performance in upcoming matches.

title: Bezos's ex-wife record $7.2 bn donation in 2025 called 'bad donation', & Musk agrees
content: Philanthropist Mackenzie Scott has donated billions at an unprecedented pace, but Y Combinator CEO Garry Tan criticizes her approach as "bad." Tan argues her lack of oversight fosters mismanagement, likening it to "pouring sugar on the floor" and citing examples of alleged chaos and unintended consequences at recipient organizations.

title: Bafta Awards 2026: 'Boong', Manipuri film wins best children‚Äôs & family film
content: Indian cinema shines as Manipuri film 'Boong' triumphed at the BAFTA Awards, securing Best Children‚Äôs & Family Film. Directed by Lakshmipriya Devi, this coming-of-age story, produced by Ritesh Sidhwani and Farhan Akhtar, captivated audiences with its portrayal of a young boy's struggle against racial tensions and family division on the Manipur border.

title: Draft income tax rules 2026: New PAN Card quoting requirements for property transactions
content: The draft new income-tax rules have proposed significant change in the scope and threshold for PAN quoting obligations for transactions of purchase or sale of immovable property.

title: Horrific double murder in Delhi: Woman, daughter killed; bodies found in bed box
content: A horrifying double murder in Sarita Vihar has left a 35-year-old woman and her six-year-old daughter dead, their bodies discovered hidden in a bed box. Police are investigating a neighbour, an accountant, as the prime suspect, exploring a motive of rejected advances. The husband returned home to find the door locked, initiating a desperate search for his family.

title: Inside Sidney Crosby and Kathy Leutner‚Äôs combined $76M net worth
content: The net worth of Sidney Crosby and Kathy Leutner is estimated to be 76 million, with the ongoing NHL season. Penguins' captain has mostly acquired his fortune in salary and endorsements, whilst Leutner has established a separate model career. This is a breakdown of how the NHL star and his spouse are in their financial position in 2026.

title: Taylor Swift‚Äôs one-word comment turns Shiffrin‚Äôs gold into Swiftie moment
content: Mikaela Shiffrin celebrated her 2026 Winter Olympics slalom gold with Taylor Swift lyrics on Instagram, then got a 1-word comment from the pop star: ‚ÄúHISTORIC ������.‚Äù Inside how Shiffrin uses ‚ÄúRuin the Friendship‚Äù to fuel races, why Swift‚Äôs reply mattered, and how the singer keeps stealing scenes at the Winter Games with Breezy Johnson too.

title: Connor McDavid and wife Lauren Kyle McDavid combined net worth 2026
content: The success of the professional career of Connor McDavid and his wife, Lauren Kyle McDavid, is reflected in the financial empire they have created. Whether it is McDavid and his lucrative Edmonton Oilers contract and endorsement book or the growing design and hospitality businesses of Lauren, the two have a combined net worth in 2026 that can be seen as a wise investment, brand strength and long-term excellence on and off the ice.

title: 'Drop the ego': Markram after South Africa thrash India in Super 8 clash
content: South Africa thrashed India by 76 runs in their T20 World Cup Super 8 opener, exposing India‚Äôs batting flaws as they collapsed to 111 chasing 188. Aiden Markram praised his team‚Äôs adaptability, Miller-Brevis partnership and smart finishing, urging players to ‚Äúdrop the ego.‚Äù The loss leaves India in a must-win situation for their remaining games.

title: 'Opened a massage parlour?' 3 NE women 'racially abused' by neighbours in Delhi ‚Äì video viral
content: Three women from Arunachal Pradesh alleged racial slurs and humiliation by neighbours in Malviya Nagar, Delhi, after a dispute over repair work. A viral video captured the incident, leading to an FIR against the couple for offensive remarks and intimidation. The women seek an apology and fear for their safety.

title: 'Played poor shots': SL captain blasts batters after Super 8 defeat against England
content: England launched their Super Eight campaign with a commanding 51-run victory over Sri Lanka in the T20 World Cup. Despite a strong bowling effort, Sri Lanka faltered in their chase, succumbing to 95 all out. Captain Shanaka acknowledged poor batting despite a competitive bowling performance, highlighting missed opportunities in a crucial World Cup encounter.

title: For a change: Kishan, not Abhishek, goes for duck against SA in Super 8 clash
content: India faced an early setback as Ishan Kishan departed for a duck against South Africa. Earlier, David Miller's aggressive 63 and Dewald Brevis's 45 powered South Africa to 187/7, despite Jasprit Bumrah's stellar bowling. Tristan Stubbs' late fireworks ensured a challenging total for India in the Super Eights clash.

title: 'Drop the items!' Tense final warning before agents shot armed intruder at Trump's Mar-a-Lago resort
content: An armed man in his early 20s was fatally shot by Secret Service agents after breaching the inner security perimeter of Donald Trump's Mar-a-Lago resort early Sunday. The unidentified suspect, reportedly carrying a shotgun and fuel can, was ordered to drop his items before being shot. Trump was not present at the time.

title: INS Aridhaman unleashed: All about Navy's 7,000-ton nuclear stealth giant armed with K-4 SLBMs
content: India's naval strength is significantly enhanced with the upcoming commissioning of INS Aridhaman, a larger and more capable Arihant-class nuclear submarine. This vessel boasts an increased missile payload and advanced stealth features, bolstering India's continuous at-sea deterrence and second-strike capabilities. Its operational deployment marks a crucial milestone for the nation's strategic forces.

title: The Kerala Story 2 director hits back at Anurag Kashyap‚Äôs ‚ÄòBakwas picture... propaganda‚Äô remark
content: After the nationwide debate sparked by The Kerala Story, the makers are returning with a sequel titled The Kerala Story 2: Goes Beyond. Even before its release, the film has landed in controversy, followed by sharp remarks by Anurag Kashyap. In response, Kamakhya Narayan Singh issued a strong rebuttal in a video statement, also addressing criticism from actor Prakash Raj and others.

title: Where will the Olympics be held in 2028, 2030 and 2032? Host cities explained
content: ‚ÄãThe 2026 Winter Olympics are taking place in northern Italy right now. Milan and Cortina d‚ÄôAmpezzo are hosting athletes from around the world. As the Games get closer to the closing ceremony, people are already looking ahead. The next Olympic host cities have been decided, and preparations are moving forward.

title: 'That is shocking': Gambhir faces heat after Axar sits out IND vs SA match
content: India captain Suryakumar Yadav said the unchanged XI meant Axar Patel was left out again, calling it a harsh but tactical call. The decision triggered fan backlash online. South Africa recovered from 20/3 through David Miller and Dewald Brevis, posting 187/7. Miller and Brevis led the fightback, while Tristan Stubbs finished strongly. Jasprit Bumrah starred with 3/15, but India face a tough chase.

title: From posters in Delhi to multi-state raids: How cops busted Pak-backed terror plot in India
content: Delhi Police busted a Pakistan-linked LeT terror module, arresting eight suspects across Delhi, West Bengal, and Tamil Nadu. The group, directed by a Bangladesh-based handler, allegedly pasted anti-national posters and planned terror activities. This operation thwarted a major untoward incident, with intelligence suggesting potential IED attacks.

title: 'Global power that is India': Netanyahu's message ahead of PM Modi's Israel visit
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu hailed India as a "global power" ahead of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's upcoming visit. Netanyahu emphasized the "special relationship" forged between the two nations and their leaders, highlighting plans to strengthen economic, diplomatic, and security ties. The visit, Modi's second to Israel, will include a speech at the Knesset and a visit to Yad Vashem.

title: Bhupen Borah‚Äôs BJP switch: Ghosts of past rifts haunt Congress before Assam elections
content: Congress faces a significant setback in Assam as former state chief Bhupen Borah joins the BJP, echoing past defections. Borah cited humiliation and marginalization by party leaders Gaurav Gogoi and Rakibul Hussain as reasons for his departure, highlighting internal rifts ahead of assembly elections.

title: Johnny Depp‚Äôs quiet act of friendship: How he gave Eric Dance a home and eased his ALS burden before passing
content: Johnny Depp offered a significant gesture of friendship to Eric Dane during his battle with ALS, providing him with rent-free accommodation in one of his Los Angeles homes. This support eased financial burdens for Dane as his health declined, allowing him to focus on his fight against the disease and his advocacy efforts.

title: 'Aura no longer there': 'Devastated' Australia under fire after disastrous T20 WC
content: Australia's Twenty20 World Cup campaign ended in a group stage exit, prompting calls for a rebuild ahead of the 2028 tournament. Coach Andrew McDonald defended his squad selection despite criticism from former players like Glenn McGrath and Mark Waugh, who questioned the inclusion of out-of-form players and the absence of key fast bowlers.

title: Man with shotgun, fuel can tries to enter Trump's Mar-a-Lago resort, shot dead
content: An armed man carrying a shotgun and fuel can was shot and killed by secret service agents and a sheriff's deputy after breaching the secure perimeter of Mar-a-Lago. The incident occurred while President Trump was at the White House, and follows previous threats and security incidents involving the president.

title: Zoe Atkin family: Meet her parents, sister Izzy Atkin and their close bond
content: Zoe Atkin is on the verge of creating history for Team GB at the Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics. The 23-year-old freestyle skier qualified first in the women‚Äôs freeski halfpipe event in Livigno. She now heads into the final as one of the strongest contenders for gold. Atkin has been in top form this season and arrives in Italy as the reigning world champion and World Cup leader.

title: 'Why did India not wait?' Cong questions timing of US trade deal; cites SC tariff ruling
content: Congress MP Jairam Ramesh questioned the Centre's decision to agree to a trade deal framework with Washington before the US Supreme Court ruled on Trump tariffs. He argued India could have negotiated from a stronger position had it waited for the court's verdict, which ultimately found the administration exceeded its authority on tariffs.

title: 'Imperils Republic's image': Delhi court blasts Congress' 'shirtless' protest at AI Summit
content: A Delhi court has remanded four Indian Youth Congress workers to five-day police custody, deeming their protest at the AI Impact Summit-2026 a "blatant assault on public order" that harmed India's diplomatic image. The activists wore provocative T-shirts, chanted slogans, and assaulted police personnel, raising concerns about potential external conspiracies and absconding associates.

title: Hara-kiri at Pallekele! Sri Lanka batters surrender meekly; England win by 51 runs
content: Phil Salt‚Äôs sublime 62 laid the foundation for England‚Äôs commanding win before Sri Lanka‚Äôs batting imploded spectacularly in Kandy. After their bowlers restricted England to a below-par 146, Sri Lanka collapsed in a heap, undone by reckless shot selection and relentless pressure from England‚Äôs attack, led by Will Jacks and Jofra Archer.

title: 'Mom, he will kill me today': Mother recalls chilling last call in Tripura teen assault case
content: A 19-year-old student from Tripura was allegedly confined, assaulted, and raped by her live-in partner in Gurugram. Her mother and lawyer claim she endured prolonged torture, including being burned and cut, with attempts on her life. Police are investigating the serious allegations.

title: Zareen Khan shares emotional update as mother hospitalised again
content: Zareen Khan has once again left fans concerned after revealing that her mother has been hospitalised again. Taking to her Instagram Stories, Salman Khan's Veer co-star shared an emotional note, urging everyone to keep her mother in their prayers during this difficult phase.

title: Two sisters found dead in Jodhpur on wedding eve; no suicide note recovered
content: Two sisters, Shobha (25) and Vimla (23), were found dead at their Jodhpur home on Friday, just a day before their scheduled weddings.  They were rushed to a hospital around 4 am after their health suddenly deteriorated, but were declared dead on arrival. Preliminary investigations suggest poisoning, with the post-mortem report to confirm the exact cause.

title: Iran-US tensions: Tehran takes Hezbollah's reins, 'week' away from having bomb-grade uranium
content: US envoy Steve Witkoff warns Iran could be a week from producing bomb-grade uranium, despite past strikes.  Washington remains concerned about Tehran's nuclear ambitions, with US President Donald Trump demanding "zero enrichment" but reportedly considering limited, verifiable civilian enrichment. Domestic protests in Iran are also a factor in US policy.

title: Iran's Gen-Z Rallies For Second Day As Fears Of War With US Mount
content: Iranian students gathered for fresh pro- and anti-government rallies Sunday commemorating those killed in recent protests, as fears loomed of renewed conflict with the United States over the country's nuclear programme.

title: "Why Are You Protecting The Congress?" PM Modi Asks Media
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi launched his sharpest attack yet on the Congress over the protests by the Youth Congress during the recently concluded AI Impact Summit and the resulting deadlock in Parliament.

title: 'SIR In Manipur Must Check Abnormal Growth': Ex Union Minister
content: The voter roll cleanup exercise SIR in Manipur must go beyond routine updating, and focus on strict scrutiny of abnormal growth patterns, former Union Minister Rajkumar Ranjan Singh has said in a statement.

title: 21 Priests To Bring Soil From Ayodhya For Bengal Ram Temple
content: Preparations are underway for an Ayodhya-style Ram temple with a 'Bengali' idol in West Bengal's Nadia district, with the Shri Krittibas Ram Mandir Trust announcing a symbolic Ayodhya Yatra to bring sacred soil for the temple's foundation.

title: Mamata Banerjee INDIA Bloc Chief: Mani Shankar Aiyar's Message To Rahul Gandhi
content: Congress's Mani Shankar Aiyar, known for his controversial statements on multiple issues, this time advised his party's senior leader Rahul Gandhi to leave INDIA Bloc's driving seat to leaders of the regional parties.

title: Armed Man Shot Dead After Forced Entry Into Donald Trump's Florida Home
content: An armed man who illegally entered the premises of US President Donald Trump's Mar-a-Lago estate in Florida was shot dead by Secret Service agents.

title: Telangana BJP Chief Taken Into "Preventive Custody", Later Released
content: Telangana BJP president N Ramchander Rao and at least 10 party workers were taken into preventive custody on Sunday and later released, police said.

title: 2 Policemen Found Dead With Bullet Wounds At Border Outpost In Punjab
content: Two policemen with bullet wounds were found dead inside an outpost near the India and Pakistan border in Punjab's Gurdaspur district today.

title: 'Cannot Disrupt Public Order': Court Denies Bail To AI Summit Protestors
content: A Delhi court observed that while the right to protest is a fundamental feature of democracy, it cannot be exercised in a manner that disrupts public order or harms the rights of others, particularly at an international event.

title: VIT Chennai's Touring Talkies Gives Gen Z A Taste Of Vintage Cinema
content: In an age of streaming platforms and plush multiplexes, students at VIT Chennai briefly travelled back to a time when cinema meant dusty grounds, wooden benches and giant tents fluttering under the open sky.

title: Khaled Meshaal Or Khalil Al-Hayya: Hamas In Final Stage Of Naming New Chief
content: A senior Hamas official told AFP on Sunday that the Palestinian Islamist movement was in the final phase of selecting a new leader, with two prominent figures competing for the position.

title: All 4 Moscow Airports Shut Down, At Least 11 Ukrainian Drones Destroyed
content: All four international airports of the Russian capital were closed due to safety concerns on Sunday afternoon until further notice as air defence forces shot down 11 Ukrainian drones within an hour.

title: Amaravati To Get India's First Quantum Valley, Anchored By IBM
content: Amaravati, the under-construction capital of Andhra Pradesh, is preparing to host what could become one of the most consequential pieces of scientific infrastructure ever built in India: a full-scale quantum computing facility anchored by IBM.

title: Guwahati Terminal Expansion Strengthens Assam Connectivity, Lifts Capacity To 13.1 Million
content: The new terminal at Lokapriya Gopinath Bardoloi International Airport (LGBIA) began commercial operations this evening, raising annual passenger capacity to 13.1 million.

title: No Curbs, Cooling Off Period: Rajnath Singh On Books By Military Officers
content: There is no proposal for a 20-year cooling-off period for retired army officers writing books, and no proposal has been made in the Cabinet regarding this, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh has said.

title: Army Dog 'Tyson' Shot, Leads Troops To Eliminate 3 Jaish Terrorists In J&K
content: In a display of unwavering bravery, Army dog Tyson led troops to a terrorist hideout in the Chhatroo area of Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar, helping security forces eliminate three Jaish-e-Mohammed terrorists.

title: Top Maoist Leader, Key "Strategist" Devji Surrenders In Telangana
content: Top Maoist commander and the organisation's key "strategist" Thippiri Tirupati alias Devji has surrendered, a top police official said on Sunday.

title: "Have You Opened Massage Parlour?" 3 Arunachal Women Face Racism In Delhi
content: Three women from Arunachal Pradesh were allegedly subjected to racial slurs, humiliation and intimidation by their neighbours following a dispute over some repair work at their rented flat in south Delhi's Malviya Nagar.

title: Jodhpur Sisters, Aged 25 And 23, Die By Suicide On Their Wedding Day
content: A household which was preparing for the wedding festivities of their two daughters was plunged into sadness when the sisters died the same day in Jodhpur's Manai village, with officials saying both women allegedly consumed a poisonous substance.
